alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 7:39AM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend, Galveston and Harris. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, northern Friendswood, Deer Park, eastern Rosenberg, Stafford, South Houston, Bellaire, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Webster, northern Manvel, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Macgregor and Astrodome Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
